snippet: A magistrate judge on Tuesday certified the suit, which alleges that the Census Bureau’s use of criminal background checks for part-time workers unlawfully screened out 250,000 African-Americans.
abstract: United States magistrate judge in Southern District of New York certifies class-action lawsuit against the Department of Commerce, which alleges that the Census Bureau’s use of criminal background checks for part-time workers unlawfully screened out 250,000 African-American applicants.
lead_paragraph: A magistrate judge on Tuesday certified the suit, which alleges that the Census Bureau’s use of criminal background checks for part-time workers unlawfully screened out 250,000 African-Americans.

headline.main: Class-Action Suit Can Proceed Against Census
headline.print_headline: Class Action Can Proceed Against Census
